datafield.subfield: Numerical Simulations of the Interactions Between a Pneumatic Tire and Granular Sand by 3D DEM-FEM

This work is concerned with a three-dimensional combined discrete-finite element modeling for the investigation of the interactions between a pneumatic tire and granular sand. In this work, the DEM is used for the modeling of granular sand, and the FEM for the pneumatic tire. Discrete elements are generated in preprocessing software and consolidated under gravity, whereas the tire is simplified to four parts, tread, carcass, tire side and rim. Interactions between the tire and granular sand are described by a contact algorithm. Travel performance of the tire on granular sand under different slip conditions is simulated, where several parameters, such as drawbar pull, sinkage and normal load, are investigated.
